types.html:
faux-bourdon m (plural faux-bourdons)

  1. drone (bee)
    • 2013 February 15, Stéphanie Forestier, “C’est le moment de louer une ruche”, in le Parisien:
      Les abeilles dites Frère Adam ont d’abord grandi dans une nurserie et sont issues d’une reine et d’un faux-bourdon.
      The so-called Brother Adam bees first grew up in a nursery and came from a queen and a drone.
  2. a musical style in which a countermelody sung above the melody and another sung below create the impression of a bass that isn't really there
trans: a musical style in which a countermelody sung above the melody and another sung below create the impression of a bass that isn't really there

title: faux-bourdon
pronunHtml: • IPA(key): /fo.buʁ.dɔ̃/
